text: going into the Olympics in 1988 in
Calgary I had won the Olympics in 84 and
so I was sort of the defending champion
to skate to Carmen was an idea my coach
from Allah and I had almost at the same
time I felt okay I can relate to her you
know I always like to be playful on the
ice I like to flirt one of my big rivals
for the last year's was Debbie Thomas
from America funny enough I find out in
the fall that she skates to the music of
Carmen as well they made up the Battle
of the two Carmen's with Debbie Thomas
being an American me coming from East
Germany this competition was really
building up my dress for Carmen was
supposed to be a sexy of course I was so
nervous I kept always going back into
the bathroom you know and thinking okay
a little lipstick eyeshadow and lipstick
I heard this I think after the
competition was done and I saw the
pictures I'm like oh my god
you step on the ice your name is
pronounced there's this moment of
silence if I wasn't thoughts go at once
and sometimes and can be very lonely
that it's one little moment when you
stand there in my first section I had
three difficult jumps and it was really
important for that moment that I hit one
after another to be comfortable and to
be confident for the rest of the program
and I nailed them all perfectly going
into my second section which was a slow
sectional I was able to breathe a little
bit and where I had the chance just to
pose I think I was posing for 30 or 40
seconds almost doing nothing flirting
with the audience flirting with the
judges the end of course is very
dramatic Harmon is being stabbed so I
you know having this dismal vent going
on
and I laid down on the ice and I am
physically undead because I'm tired I'm
exhausted I wasn't so sure if it was
enough for me to win the gold medal
Debbie was actually skating after my
performance the coach gave her a high
five she gave back and she missed it so
I said then I'm thinking hmm she's not
really on the edge she starts out the
program she has a mistake right away and
she starts having here little mistake
there little mistake where she jumps her
triples but she doesn't lend perfectly I
felt very sorry I must say I mean you
still want to go out and be the one who
did better and wins but still you want
your competitor to deliver when I
finally found out that I won I guess it
was just like big big burden came off my
shoulder I was just relieved and I
wanted to say congratulation to Debbie
and she wouldn't react like she wouldn't
even look at me
that music her character that destroy is
so much part of my life story you know
that I always feel I never let her go
you
